channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Shrubbery obstructing pavement, 18th December
item.description:
Shrubbery growth obstructing pavement for years. Difficult to define whether in garden of 61 Abbey Road end of fencing as you walk down Ripley Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ripley Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working out side number 66 and64, 18th December
item.description:
I am disabled and have already had a fall down the steps outside my house . Plus my car has. Been broken into for disabled badge twice .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Parkdale Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Warning road furniture left on pavement, 18th December
item.description:
A yellow and a grey road thing to block areas off for work has been left on the pavement outside 60 Sheridan Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Sheridan Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Tree in road, 18th December
item.description:
A tree has fallen in the road and is nearly impassable, junction of Wickham road and overbury avenue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wickham Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.description:
More graffiti in this area. Another tag on wall this time next to Tesco

item.title: Shopping trolley (reported elsewhere on site) filled with rubbish, 18th December
item.description:
This trolley has been here for weeks and is attracting bags of litter added at different times
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ripley Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Red barrier where the street lights are down sticking out in the road and difficult to see as no street lights, 18th December
item.description:
Red barrier near the sleeping policemen which are down sticking out into the road unsecured as are the emergency cones that are there. Very difficult to see especially in this weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Birdpoo AGAIN on wooden bench., 18th December
item.description:
The tree above this seat needs cutting back as the birds continuously poo on the seat. Making it totally UN sitable This is the 3rd time it’s been cleaned. Please move the seat to somewhere away from tree.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Westmoreland Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple street lights out of order, 18th December
item.description:
There’s around 4-5 street lamps which are not working along the path which makes the area very dark to walk through, causing potential tripping hazards and it feels unsafe to walk there. The path is used by commuters, dog walkers and for leisure purposes
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenesk Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant flytipping, 18th December
item.description:
Rubbish is dumped here almost every week. As soon as it’s cleared more appears. Please do something to stop it permanently. Maybe plant a garden or put planters

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Crewdson Road, Oval, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12" round pothole,,deep with sharp edges in normal path of cyclists, 18th December
item.description:
Pothole deep and sharp enough to burst my tyres and break a wheel. In normal path for cyclists. Lucky to stay upright but had to abandon riding and walk broken bike home. Could be very dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wood Vale, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At the junction, 18th December
item.description:
Huge puddles stopping people from crossing safely. Unable to cross the road, plus high splashes by cars driving through. This has been a problem for years in winter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Endsleigh Gardens, St Pancras, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge has been left, 18th December

Fridge freezer has been left
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellmeadow Road, Catford South, Greater London

item.title: Signs used by Thames water not removed, 18th December
item.description:
These signs outside number 24 Ripley Road have been in the road for some months now. Twice reported to T.W ref 01422242. 2 small road signs and one triangular sign. Obstructing parking
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ripley Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Pothole, 18th December
item.description:
Pothole getting larger due to bad weather - becoming dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Torbay Street, Kentish Town, Greater London

item.title: Flooding on road by bus stop when it rains, 18th December
item.description:
As you can see, I reported this two months ago. It was reported as having been fixed over a month ago. As you can also see from the attached photograph this has not been fixed. Indeed nothing has been done as it is a major issue from the last resurfacing of this road. Your contractors have lied to you! I await to hear from you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Kent Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slippery leaves and mud swamp on pavement, 18th December
item.description:
Slippery muddy mixture of leaves and mud on pavement between the billiards on Hawesbrook Lane section where meets Dustan Lane just before LPPS primary. Dangerous to walk through for school children and the public. Road sweeper couldn’t get down there to clear the leaves so needs shovel to clear area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnfield Wood Road, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old settee, 18th December
item.description:
This has not been resolved its still outside 14,Newent close SE15 6EF Please remove as its been dumped
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newent Close, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 18th December
item.description:
Fly tipped cooker top, has been there since the evening of 17th Dec

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Parkview Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin has been in pathway abandoned for over a year, 18th December
item.description:
This bin is always on the public pathway outside number 104, and causes a dangerous obstacle next to the neighbouring primary school. This has been reported numerous times including REF 8553245 as the latest, with no resolution. It needs to be removed please, it has been months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
